instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.3V42_G3H: What is 3V42_G3H? This is shorthand for PP3V42_G3H which is one of the first power rails that must turn on in older Macbooks that use a magsafe charger in order for them to get a light on the charger. This power rail powers the onewire circuit and the SMC, which are necessary for the machine to communicate with the charger and get it to turn on, as well as begin the bootup sequence. .
definitions.U7090: What is U7090? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V42_G3H.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> low.
threads.message:
hi, this came in with ppbus 8.2v
i changed smc straight away, ppbus go 8.6v, machine turn on.
a few days later,customer came, the machine is dead again.
I see <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 4v,sometimes 0.5v.
I remove fuse, and I have 8.6v at pin 1. so it must be system side ? do i check for short one by one?
I have seek thermal cam, but nothing shows heat.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> low.
threads.message:
Resolder the fuse and check diode mode reading on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.
Compare reading with all big coils.

Check resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.
Did you try SMC bypass?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> low.
threads.message:
diode mode with fuse connected : 0.110
resistance 17/18 27/28 3.5 and 20 ohm, normal.
the closest value i found is at :
L7130 : 0.115
L7630 : 0.120

the rest diode mode is around 0.300 - 0.400, looks good.
L7310 and L7320 is 0.05, i think its normal.
cant start in smc bypass.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> low.
threads.message: Test with fake charger, or lab PSU with 45/60W cable.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> low.
threads.message:
with fake charger, still the same exact behaviour.
when i leave the board long enough, the ppbus will start at around 8v, and then slowly dropping to very low value. (2v or something )

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> low.
threads.message:
Change <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> and check all its solders, traces and surrounding components.
Board turns on with a charged battery?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> low.
threads.message:
<CHIP>U7100</CHIP> changed, all component surrounding has been checked, all good.
board doesnt turn on with charged battery.
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> start at 8.6v when i plug magsafe, and drop slowly till magsafe light goes off.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> low.
threads.message:
Post <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> basic voltages; pins 1, 2, 3, 9, 12, 13, 14, 17, 19, 20, 27.
Specify which ones drop in time.
<SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> stable?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> low.
threads.message:
1 0v
2 16v stable
3 4.3v stable
9 0v
12
13
14
17
19
20
27
midway writing this, found out pp3v42 is only around 1.8v
pp3v42 diode mode is 0.278, good.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> low.
threads.message: i have <SIGNAL>PPVIN_P3V42G3H</SIGNAL>, <CHIP>U7090</CHIP> looks touched before by previous technician, so I replaced and I have stable pp3v42 and its turning on now, will get back later if something is wrong again.
